de.esoco.lib.proxy.interception

Class InterceptionAdvice

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.proxy.interception.InterceptionAdvice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public abstract class InterceptionAdvice
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Base class for advice on interceptions. It is modelled after the principles of aspect orientation and allows to apply certain crosscutting functionality like logging to interceptions of an interception proxy, independent of the actual function of the interception or the method(s) behind it.

    There are several ways to use this class. The easiest is to implement one or more of its specific advice methods like before() or after() which have a default implementation that does nothing. Implementing these methods can easily be done in anonymous adapter classes, for example.

    If the subclass needs to handle the invocation of the underlying interceptions specially it can override the invoke() method which, in the default implementation, calls the Interception.invoke() method. But it also handles the invocation of chained advice (setup by the interception proxy). Therefore a subclass overriding invoke() should always call super.invoke() to perform the actual interception invocation, else the chaining mechanism won't work anymore.

    Finally, a subclass may also override the advise() method to implement it's own advice handling without the invocation of the specific advice methods. Again, the subclass should always call super.invoke() to perform the interception invocation to keep the advice chain working.

        public InterceptionAdvice()

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Creates a copy of this advice object. This method is used by the interception proxy to duplicate advice instances in case of advice chain conflicts. A subclass containing fields that need special treatment in a clone method (like references to mutable objects) must override this method and handle such fields respectively.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the new instance

      • getNextAdvice

        public final InterceptionAdvice getNextAdvice()
        Package internal method that returns the reference to a chained advice object that is wrapped by this one.
        Returns:
        The next advice object or NULL for none

      • invoke

        public java.lang.Object invoke(Interception rInterception,
                               java.lang.Object rProxy,
                               java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                               java.lang.Object rTarget,
                               java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
                        throws java.lang.Throwable
        The method that performs the interception invocation. If a next advice has been set by the interception proxy, the invocation will be forwarded to the chained advice's advise() method.

        If a subclass chooses to override this method it should at least always invoke super.invoke() to support the chaining of advice.

        Parameters:
        rInterception - The interception to be advised.
        rProxy - The proxy on which the method has been invoked
        rMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rTarget - The object on which the method shall be invoked
        rArgs - The original method arguments
        Returns:
        The result of the interception invocation
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Any kind of exception may be thrown

      • advise

        protected java.lang.Object advise(Interception rInterception,
                                  java.lang.Object rProxy,
                                  java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                                  java.lang.Object rTarget,
                                  java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
                           throws java.lang.Throwable
        The main method that executes the actual advice on the interception. It invokes the specialized advice methods in this class (like before() or after()) which may be overridden by subclasses. The default implementations simply do nothing.

        If a subclass chooses to override this method it should at least always invoke the method invoke() to support the chaining of advice that may have been setup by the InterceptionProxy class.

        Parameters:
        rInterception - The interception to be advised.
        rProxy - The proxy on which the method has been invoked
        rMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rTarget - The object on which the method shall be invoked
        rArgs - The original method arguments
        Returns:
        The result of the interception invocation
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Any kind of exception may be thrown

      • after

        protected void after(java.lang.Object rInvoked,
                     java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                     java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method can be implemented to perform actions either after an interception returned normally of after it threw an exception. It will be invoked by the default implementations of afterReturn() and afterThrow().
        Parameters:
        rInvoked - The object the methpd has been invoked on
        rMethod - The invoked method
        rArgs - The method arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Any kind of exception may be thrown

      • afterReturn

        protected void afterReturn(java.lang.Object rReturn,
                           java.lang.Object rInvoked,
                           java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                           java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
                    throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method can be implemented to perform actions after an interception exectuted successfully (i.e., without throwing an exception). The default implementation just invokes after() which by default does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rReturn - The return value of the method call
        rInvoked - The object on which the method had been invoked
        rMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rArgs - The original method arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Any kind of exception may be thrown

      • afterThrow

        protected void afterThrow(java.lang.Throwable rThrown,
                          java.lang.Object rInvoked,
                          java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                          java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method can be implemented to perform actions after an interception threw an exception. The default implementation just invokes after() which by default does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rThrown - The exception thrown
        rInvoked - The object on which the method had been invoked
        rMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rArgs - The original method arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Any kind of exception may be thrown

      • before

        protected void before(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                      java.lang.reflect.Method rMethod,
                      java.lang.Object[] rArgs)
               throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method can be implemented to perform actions before an interception will be exectuted. The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The object on which the method will been invoked
        rMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rArgs - The original method arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Any kind of exception may be thrown
